00026         LevelManager::LevelManager()
00027         {
00028             level = 0;
00029             queue = false;
00030             timeFactor = 1.0f;
00031         }
00032 
00033         LevelManager::~LevelManager()
00034         {
00035             if(level)
00036                 delete level;
00037         }
00038 
00039         LevelManager *LevelManager::getInstance()
00040         {
00041             static LevelManager instance;
00042             return &instance;
00043         }
00044 
00045         Level *LevelManager::getLevel() const
00046         {
00047             return level;
00048         }
00049 
00050         void LevelManager::run()
00051         {
00052             /* Behold, as I have been told
00053              * what follows below
00054              * is very important, you know! */
00055             InputManager *inputManager = InputManager::getInstance();
00056             TimeManager *timeManager = TimeManager::getInstance();
00057             VideoManager *videoManager = VideoManager::getInstance();
00058             //EffectManager *effectManager = EffectManager::getInstance();
00059             SketchManager *sketchManager = SketchManager::getInstance();
00060 
00061             FPSLogger fps;
00062 
00063             long lastUpdate = timeManager->getTicks();
00064             while(!inputManager->hasQuitEvent()) {
00065 
00066                 /* Calculate the ticks that have passed. */
00067                 long ticks = timeManager->getTicks();
00068                 float ms = (float)(ticks - lastUpdate);
00069                 lastUpdate = ticks;
00070 
00071                 /* Update the input state. */
00072                 inputManager->update(ms);
00073 
00074                 /* Update the level. */
00075                 if(level && ms > 0.0f)
00076                     level->update(timeFactor * ms);
00077 
00078                 /* Update other things. */
00079                 //effectManager->update(timeFactor * ms);
00080                 fps.update(ms);
00081 
00082                 /* Setup the videoManager for rendering. */
00083                 videoManager->clear();
00084                 videoManager->identity();
00085 
00086                 /* Render the level first, this will also apply our camera
00087                  * transformation, which is good, since the effect manager
00088                  * wants the same transformation. */
00089                 if(level)
00090                     level->render();
00091                 //effectManager->render();
00092                 fps.render();
00093 
00094                 /* Flip the video buffer. */
00095                 videoManager->flip();
00096 
00097                 /* Update level queue. */
00098                 if(queue) {
00099                     /* Remove old level. */
00100                     if(level)
00101                         delete level;
00102 
00103                     //effectManager->clear();
00104                     sketchManager->clear();
00105 
00106                     /* Load new level. */
00107                     level = new Level(queueFileName);
00108                     queue = false;
00109                     timeFactor = 1.0f;
00110 
00111                     /* Loading the level might have taken some time, so we skip
00112                      * some ticks. */
00113                     lastUpdate = timeManager->getTicks();
00114                 }
00115             }
00116         }
00117 
00118         void LevelManager::queueLevel(const string &fileName)
00119         {
00120             queue = true;
00121             queueFileName = fileName;
00122         }
00123

00125         {
00126             return timeFactor;
00127         }

00129         void LevelManager::setTimeFactor(float timeFactor)
00130         {
00131             this->timeFactor = timeFactor;
00132         }
00133     }
